content.webTitle: Strong commodity prices boost Rio Tinto's output

fields.headline: Strong commodity prices boost Rio Tinto's output
fields.bodyText: Rio Tinto, the world's second-largest mining company, said it had increased production of iron ore and copper in the second quarter of this year as commodity prices rose with sustained demand growth from developing countries. The London-listed group said it had increased its output of refined copper by 35% from a year ago, its mined copper output had increased 9%, and iron ore output had risen 4%. In February, it gave shareholders a $1.5bn (£850m) special dividend after record earnings in 2005. Copper and iron ore contributed three-quarters of underlying earnings.
